body.p: HPE Helion OpenStack 3.0.1 focuses mainly on fixed for Boot from SAN support over FCoE using QLogic FlexFabric adapters. Other issues addressed are listed below.

section.title: Fixed in this release

ul.li: Fixed: Issues with FCOE BfS support: (Failed to detect 3PAR disks for native-fcoe install boot from san), (Persistent device naming / FCoE indentification), (multipath does not return all paths for a four-path/LUN, 256 LUN FCoE/multipath setup), (The -B option on the multipathd is not being honoured.)
Fixed: kernel defect (Compute Node unreachable from the lifecycle manager node during run of hlm-status playbook).

Fixed: Race condition (If the login to the ISCSI target takes too long (more that a second) then when the vgchange -a y VG runs it cant find the VG because it has not finished the login process and then the files systems are not mounted.)

section.p: Fixed: Ironic OSSA (Vulnerability in OpenStack Ironic whereby Ironic node information including credentials is exposed to unauthenticated users.)
Fixed: Upgrade may fail - Can't load firmware file bnx2x/bnx2x-e2-7.12.30.0.fw. This issue, present in HPE Helion OpenStack 3.0 has been fixed in HPE Helion OpenStack 3.0.1.

body.section: New in this release A new check has been added to the percona play to check for cluster partitioning. Information is available in
Issues in this release Problem: The ESX compute instance losses its ping to the instance private IP address after taking snapshot of ESX compute instances.
Workaround: Restart the particular OVSvAPP node of the host on which instance is launched.
Problem: Load balancer instances stuck in pending_delete or Error state require manual ceanup.

Upgrading to or installing HPE Helion OpenStack 3.0.1 To install or upgrade to version 3.0.1, you will need the file called HPE Helion OpenStack hos-3.0.1 (build 01-1343) inside of which is hos-3.0.1-20160722T144646Z.tar at /media/cdrom/hos/hos-3.0.1-20160722T144646Z.tar.

To upgrade, use these files/filenames and follow the upgrade instructions here. The ony difference is the files used.
To perform a clean install, use the new file names above, and follow the instructions for your particular configuration in the installation section.
